intro: Delissea hanaensis, commonly known as the Hanaensis Delissea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
